title: ID Software making a new game!
content:
"We are working on an all-new franchise: it's not Doom, it's not Quake, it's not Wolfenstein, it's not Enemy Territory, it's not even Commander Keen!"

Boo, so no we know its not Commander Keen 7 BUT all of the ID franchises have been sucessful I thinks. I wonder what they are working on? Any ideas?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: well...
content: The engine demo that Carmack showed off recently had buggies driving through a post-apocalyptic desert setting...  Who knows!

title: Re: well...
content:
Ah, no idea. But at least they made it clear it won't be Keen. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-foot.gif[/img] Heh.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: well...
content:
I'm just surprised they acknowledged Keen's existence... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: well
content:
You know, for me platformers are the only kind of games that are worth a look nowadays. The only FPS/3D game I've ever liked is Duke Nukem 3D (MS Hellbender too). I don't like Wolf, Doom or Quake, and I can't stand seeing people playing Quake 3 or something in the computer room at college, really.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: well
content:
There are genres besides platformer and FPS, you know.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

I can derive amusement from some modern FPSes (UT, Quake, Prey, Doom), but there's far too much emphasis on such games, along with RPGs.

title: Re: well
content:
FPSs are fun, I especially like WW2 FPS games, but FPSs and RPGs alike don't offer enough variety, even less variety from RPGs- to me.

Platformers also have lost their variety, I think there's room still left for innovation, but it won't happen till companies put down the Mario 64-esque-scavenger hunt concept and try something new.

But lets face it, IMO almost all of the genres have become cookie cutter, with time tested concepts that are really starting to swell thanks to money having too much of a grip over the game biz.

title: Re: well
content:
I'm going to assume that id's new game will be an FPS. They've stuck with that genre for over a decade and I don't think they're stopping anytime soon.

FPSs, in general, are fun when you play them through once, but after that they lose their excitement. Also, there are a lot that, too me, just feel too much like ones that already exist. Because, on a fundamental level, there's no real innovation between any of them.

By the way, I predict their new franchise will be called, "Commanduke Quakendoom and Hoverdave."
